intro: Psychotria bracteocardia, commonly known as the "blue-eyed" Psychotria, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a small evergreen shrub characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. The plant produces small, dark blue to black berries that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Psychotria bracteocardia is notable for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
